div.head: In commendation of the worke and the Author.

lg.l: Nor dost thou praise, a pockworne tawnie trull,
Nor dost thou carue a liuelesse slubbred stone,
Nor dost thou fill thy page with great othes full,
Nor dost thou sonnet of King Salomon:
Nor dost thou like a loue-sicke milke-sop gull,
Vnto thy Mistris for a kisse make mone:
But salt with sugar, honnie mixt with gall,
Must needes be praisde, must needes be likt of al.
Now I am sure thou tendes to vertues lore,
Thus writ the Epigrammatists of yore,
And told the world her foule abusion:
Thus thou and thine shal euer enui de be,
And like a Page will Enuy tend on thee.
